Topic.Title: Error message when trying to edit published game

Posts.EditableText: Attempting to edit my game "Curse" (...review/866/ ), I am prevented by an error message. This doesn't happen with any of my other games. I had noticed previously that, in the description of the game, a hyphen had been replaced by other symbols. Is this stopping the process? In fact, that was the reason for my attempt to edit!

Posts.EditableText: <sigh> The beauty of descriptive error messages... Unless that means somethings to someone, you should be able to attach by (below this response field) clicking the "Upload attachment" tab, browsing to your file and then adding it. You don't need all the assets, just the ASLX file.

I'm seeing this error in the server log:

[quote:1is0xnpd]
hexadecimal value 0x13, is an invalid character. Line 2, position 164
[/quote:1is0xnpd]

which indicates to me that your .quest file is broken. Can you attach that here (not just the .aslx), and does it load in Quest?

Ah - I see a message saying that "The extension quest is not allowed." What now?
Posts.HTML:

Ah - I see a message saying that "The extension quest is not allowed." What now?

Posts.EditableText: I mean when you try to play the new .quest file that you're trying to upload. My bet is if the server can't open, your local copy of Quest won't be able to open it either. Anyway, email me the file and I'll take a look.
Posts.HTML: I mean when you try to play the new .quest file that you're trying to upload. My bet is if the server can't open, your local copy of Quest won't be able to open it either. Anyway, email me the file and I'll take a look.

Posts.EditableText: Many thanks. Will do. In fact, I wasn't trying to upload a new file, merely to tidy-up the introductory message! Not important, but I was concerned that, if I needed to edit the file later, I wouldn't be able to.
